info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 3:50AM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible, with accumulations of 15 to 20 inches possible and locally higher amounts up to 30 inches. Winds could gust as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades from Lake of the Woods north, including Diamond Lake, Crater Lake and portions of highways 138, 230, 62, and 140. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds combined with heavy, wet snow could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Snowfall rates could approach 1"/hr for long durations on Monday afternoon and evening. - It seems likely that around the southern edge of the current watch area, around Howard Prairie and also in the Siskiyou Mountains near Mt. Ashland, will meet winter weather advisory criteria. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * Have an emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications in your vehicle. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.
